channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @touchthesun @TheAmazingMcWil @doctorow @remembrancermx Can't believe I didn't know about this. You can find it here: https://t.co/39ZFT4n4zU
@dzkalman You call that old? I was on the AECOM bang path as a YU CS major.
@jamesdnicoll Shoulder mounted RPGs or go home.
@jr_foust @Atrios Which makes it criminally negligent the Democratic leadership isn’t trying to demonize all Republicans as fanatic anti-vaxxers.

@trekonomics He’s letting the totebaggers feel their way of life is being defended even as the powers that be sell it out.
@trekonomics The new McCarthyism should be denounced in the loudest voices from the highest places, as a denial of America’s highest ideals by a fringe tribe of Confederates and Putinists. Instead, we have the children of immigrants cowering in fear before these self-proclaimed Real Americans

@richards1052 Lots of problematic Jewish university presidents, but he definitely takes the cake.
@richards1052 But he has a marketing channel that succeeds in selling what are presumably bad Jewish books (I keep meaning to request review copies) to bad Jews.
@CoreyRobin Sadly, there’s more money to be made by titling the series Great Jews. You can get Tikvah Foundation subsidies at the front end, and sell more copies via the Prager show on the back end.
@JosieBeller @scalzi I meant shingles. If only there were a vaccine against middle age memory loss. Or even a daily injection!
@hallam @dburbach Luckily for all concerned, accountability is not the American way!
@shiraaahh Reading the strong critiques of The New Republic’s racism in the Peretz years was very eye opening. As has been Andrew Sullivan’s very problematic Judeophilia.
@RokhlK In which my great grandmother, a member of the shul for decades before and after, discusses the polarizing effects of Zionism: https://t.co/23mGHCvEbS
@bernstein_judah Out: Historicism. In: Accelarationism.
@avishaiw @Marcprice21 Related: https://t.co/T5E3pUOSzg

Thinking about the assignment. One could create a bot to harvest lots of tweets discussing Putin and Ukraine this week. https://t.co/nfBXtHfiMC
One could probably have a bit identify a subset of those who are clearly “leftist”
Not clear whether one could then sort based on existing sentiment analysis libraries, or would have to first create collections of pro and anti Putin tweets for training by Tensor or the like.
I’d love it if someone more up to date on current technology could weigh in on this.
Eg @rmneiss
@dzkalman “Frum Jews don’t cry,” and other fun ways to destroy your children. @FeldheimRejects
@ElLissitzky_Art @BenYehudaPress “No, I’ve never kippled. What’s it like?”

@MaNishtana Did not see option three. Also did not see that I suggested holding when I mean bolding; that is, to boldface the syllables you want to emphasize.
@MaNishtana I think three is better than the other two.
Spoiler: It’s about the Benjamins. https://t.co/2aW5w6UTYe
Embedded in the Bible are disputed assertions about a global flood and a physical firmament above the earth around which rotates the sun. https://t.co/6DdBapQr1S
@comradeaux @aew1776 Note that neither party has sought an investigation as to why the 20 year war in Afghanistan ended the way it did.
@maxberger @YehudahMirsky
If you read only one pro-extinction tweet this year…. https://t.co/DFRcyqQWnf

@MaNishtana Not a fan of ALL CAPS for syllable emphasis. Have you tried just holding it?
@MaNishtana However, I’m the guy who bulk deleted all the metegs from a siddur he published, so my views on emphasis may not be yours.
@swordsjew As a then-new technology, cloning was overused. Pretty inevitable in hindsight.
@trekonomics “Everything dies, baby, that’s a fact. But maybe everything that dies, some day comes back.”
